projectPurpose: To serve as the host operating system for the Oxide Rack, a vertically integrated rack-scale cloud computing system, managing hardware resources and hosting virtual machines.
mainFeatures: Powers the Oxide Rack hardware platform
Includes tools for building the OS distribution
Supports ZFS boot environments for system management
Integrated with a Rust-based Virtual Machine Monitor (Propolis)
Designed for tight integration with custom hardware, replacing traditional firmware

alternatives.name: Ubuntu Server / Debian (with KVM/QEMU)
alternatives.license: Open Source - GPL and other licenses
mainFeatures: Supports various file systems including ZFS on Linux

alternatives.name: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) with KVM/oVirt

marketPositioning: Helios is positioned not as a standalone operating system or hypervisor, but as a fundamental component of the Oxide Rack's vertically integrated 'cloud computer' system. It differentiates itself by being tightly coupled with custom hardware, replacing traditional firmware with a holistic software design, and providing a pre-integrated, API-driven private cloud experience, contrasting with general-purpose OS and hypervisor alternatives that run on commodity hardware and require separate management layers to achieve similar cloud-like capabilities.
